app.helpers package

Submodules

app.helpers.hash_helper module

Provides functionality for hashing strings using SHA-512 with a configurable salt.

app.helpers.hash_helper.get_hash(value: str) → str[source]

Computes a SHA-512 hash of the given string concatenated with a configured salt, and returns the hexadecimal digest.

app.helpers.hook_helper module

async app.helpers.hook_helper.load_hooks()[source]

app.helpers.image_helper module

Provides asynchronous functionality for image resizing and video frame extraction. Image resizing and video frame freezing operations are performed synchronously in separate threads to avoid blocking the event loop. This module includes functions for resizing images, extracting thumbnails from videos, and creating image thumbnails with specified dimensions and quality. It integrates with the Pillow library for image processing and FFmpeg for video frame extraction.

async app.helpers.image_helper.image_resize(path: str, width: int, height: int, quality: int)[source]

Asynchronously resizes an image to the specified width and height, and saves it with the given quality. The actual resizing is performed synchronously in a separate thread.

async app.helpers.image_helper.thumbnail_create(path: str, mimetype: str) → str | None[source]

Generates a thumbnail for the given file based on its MIME type, creating an image thumbnail from images or extracting a frame from videos, and resizing it to specified dimensions. Returns the filename of the created thumbnail if successful, otherwise returns None. Handles both image and video files, with appropriate error handling and logging for issues during thumbnail creation.

async app.helpers.image_helper.video_freeze(src_path: str, dst_path: str)[source]

Asynchronously freezes the first frame of a video and saves it as an image file by calling the synchronous _video_freeze_sync function within an executor.

app.helpers.jwt_helper module

Provides utility functions for handling JSON Web Tokens (JWTs), including creating unique identifiers (JTI), encoding user information into a JWT, and decoding a JWT to retrieve the payload. Uses the configured secret key and algorithm for encoding and decoding.

app.helpers.jwt_helper.jti_create() → str[source]

Generates a JSON Web Token Identifier (JTI) by creating a random string consisting of alphanumeric characters with a length specified in the configuration.

app.helpers.jwt_helper.jwt_decode(jwt_token: str) → dict[source]
app.helpers.jwt_helper.jwt_encode(user, token_exp: int | None = None) → str[source]

Encodes user information into a JSON Web Token (JWT) with an optional expiration time. The token includes user ID, role, login, and a unique JTI, and is signed with a secret key.

app.helpers.lock_helper module

async app.helpers.lock_helper.create_lock()[source]

Creates a lock file if the system is not already locked. The lock file is used to prevent concurrent access or indicate a restricted state. The function only writes the lock file if it does not already exist.

app.helpers.lock_helper.get_lock_time()[source]
app.helpers.lock_helper.is_locked()[source]

Checks if the lock file exists at the configured path and returns True if it does, indicating that the system is in a locked state; otherwise, returns False.

async app.helpers.lock_helper.remove_lock()[source]

Removes the lock file if it exists, thereby unlocking the system. The function only deletes the lock file if the system is currently locked. This is typically used to signal the end of a restricted state or maintenance period.

app.helpers.openapi_helper module

app.helpers.openapi_helper.load_description()[source]

Loads the OpenAPI description from the specified file path and returns the contents as a string.

app.helpers.uptime_helper module

class app.helpers.uptime_helper.Uptime[source]

Bases: object

Tracks the uptime of the application by recording the start time and providing a method to calculate the elapsed time since start.

get_uptime()[source]

Returns the uptime in seconds as an integer by calculating the difference between the current time and the recorded start time.
